entries.meaning:
(statistics) A statistical measure defined as 
  
    
      
        
          Cov
          ⁡
          (
          X
          ,
          Y
          )
          =
          E
          ⁡
          (
          (
          X
          −
          μ
          )
          (
          Y
          −
          ν
          )
          )
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle \scriptstyle \operatorname {Cov} (X,Y)=\operatorname {E} ((X-\mu )(Y-\nu ))}
  
 given two real-valued random variables X and Y, with expected values 
  
    
      
        
          E
          (
          X
          )
          
          =
          
          μ
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle \scriptstyle E(X)\,=\,\mu }
  
 and 
  
    
      
        
          E
          (
          Y
          )
          
          =
          
          ν
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle \scriptstyle E(Y)\,=\,\nu }
  
.
examples: The elements of such a correlation matrix do not have asymptotic variances and covariances of the form (1.2), even if S has a Wishart distribution.

entries.meaning: (object-oriented programming) The conversion of data types from wider to narrower in certain situations.
